title: Is it okay to hate on Cassiopeia? Or are we beating a dead horse at this point?
body:
Mainly because her passive is just a ball of stats over time, and if she gets a sliiiiight lead early on, she'll just turn into a monster even faster. 

And now the AP changes are making me cringe; I question how broken Rylai's is going to be on her now.

replies.body: Yea I still hate her, not because she was changed since I never really played her (although I can understand why those people are mad) but because she's a late game hypercarry who's also somewhat of a lane bully. Yea, she has a weak lane against specific champs, but if you pick her against champs that can't really get in range of her without getting poisoned and dpsed, then you're basically fucked. Sort of the same case with Vlad, c'ept sub the massive sustained damage with hp sustain.

Well, that's called counterpick, I believe champs like Riven or Azir are more frustrating to play against, Cassi gets oom when she does a little combo or misses too much skillshots, you can definitely play around cass.

You can blame Riot Stashu for that.

But, oh well. She's not the only champ who will benefit a lot, at least. Anivia, Brand come to mind. 

And mages as a whole could use some help. Lesser of two evils I suppose.

I do like Malz, and I think he's pretty balanced, but I think Riot's aware of this.
